definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: The king's men had been subverted and they killed him in the night.
sentences.chinese: 国王的属下已被策反，在夜里把国王杀了。

sentences.english: As the country is unstable, I pretended to be ill and escaped at night by boat. 0
sentences.chinese: 当时天下大乱，所以称病在夜里驾船逃走了。

sentences.english: Clay warehouse near 11 o clock at night, Sun Weijun decorate plan.
sentences.chinese: 夜里11点红土仓库附近，孙维君布置作战计划。

sentences.english: Night, He Junfeng sneaked into the office building, found the document.
sentences.chinese: 夜里，贺俊峰偷偷溜进办公楼里，找到了那份文件。

sentences.english: The cool night time, will cover the quilt, but during the day but still very hot.
sentences.chinese: 秋凉的时候，夜里要盖被子了，可是白天却依然很热。

sentences.english: That night I listened to a call-in program on the radio;
sentences.chinese: 那天夜里我收听了广播电台的采访节目。

sentences.english: One should bring a flashlight when walking in mountains at night.
sentences.chinese: 夜里走山路，应该带上电棒儿。

sentences.english: Moisture in the atmosphere condensed into dew during the night.
sentences.chinese: 大气中的水汽在夜里凝成了露水。

sentences.english: Then Jaimie heard a noise in the quiet night.
sentences.chinese: 接着，在寂静的夜里，杰米听到了声响。

sentences.english: It is never fastened with anything but a latch, either by day or by night.
sentences.chinese: 白天和夜里，它都只上一个活闩。

sentences.english: The dog is kenneled at night.
The bank around the corner was knocked over last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里位于拐角的那家银行被抢了。

sentences.english: He sits late at night as well as working hard during the day.
sentences.chinese: 他不但白天努力工作，夜里还常熬夜。

sentences.english: Because of the late night in, she often cannot find him to taking nicotian olfactory finger then.
sentences.chinese: 因为深夜里，她经常找不到他那带着烟草味道的手指。

sentences.english: Last night a bomb ripped apart the train in which we had been travelling.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里一颗炸弹将我们乘坐的火车炸得四分五裂。

definition: midnight/in the middle of the night
first half of the night (from nightfall to midnight)
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
first half of the night/time before midnight
the whole night/all through the night
